description.narrative: Tropical Cyclone Mick struck Fiji on 14 December 2009 causing widespread damage which included flooding to low lying areas, partial and total destruction of sub-standard buildings such as iron tin homes, and disruption to infrastructure and services such as electricity, roads and bridges. Funding under this initiative represents Australia's humanitarian emergency response to: Fiji Red Cross Society for the replenishment of pre-positioned emergency supplies such as water containers, clothing, blankets and cooking utensils; Fiji National Disaster Management Office for the hire of a helicopter to conduct aerial damage assessments and deliver emergency supplies to rural and remote areas; and to UNICEF for the replenishment of emergency supplies used to support women and children including supplies of medications and provision of child protection support. The total value of this initiative is $0.1 million to be expensed during the 2009-10 financial year.
